intro: Glossorhyncha geelvinkensis, commonly known as the Geelvinkan lily, is a rare flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, where it thrives in humid, tropical conditions. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth, waxy surface that helps retain moisture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
